edu.iu.dsc.tws.data.fs.io

Interface InputSplit<OT>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BinaryInputSplit, CSVInputSplit, DelimitedInputSplit, FileInputSplit, LocatableInputSplit, TextInputSplit

    public interface InputSplit<OT>
extends java.io.Serializable
    This interface must be implemented by all kind of input splits that can be assigned to input formats.

    Input splits are transferred in serialized form via the messages, so they need to be serializable as defined by Serializable.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Returns the number of this input split.

      Reads the next record from the input.

      Opens a parallel instance of the input format to work on a split.

      Method used to check if the end of the input is reached.

      • open

        void open()
   throws java.io.IOException
        Opens a parallel instance of the input format to work on a split.

        When this method is called, the input format it guaranteed to be configured.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the spit could not be opened due to an I/O problem.

      • open

        void open(Config config)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • reachedEnd

        boolean reachedEnd()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Method used to check if the end of the input is reached.

        When this method is called, the input format it guaranteed to be opened.

        Returns:
        True if the end is reached, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if an I/O error occurred.

      • nextRecord

        OT nextRecord(OT reuse)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the next record from the input.

        When this method is called, the input format it guaranteed to be opened.

        Parameters:
        reuse - Object that may be reused.
        Returns:
        Read record.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if an I/O error occurred.

      • close

        void close()
    throws java.io.IOException
        Method that marks the end of the life-cycle of an input split. Should be used to close channels and streams and release resources. After this method returns without an error, the input is assumed to be correctly read.

        When this method is called, the input format it guaranteed to be opened.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the input could not be closed properly.
